Straight Shot thinks for a moment.  She then looks to Lord Elder and the ot=
hers.

" Yeah I miss the old Perceptor too, we were just getting ta know hi=
m when everything went South.  Tucson and I would often run errands between=
 Ratchet, Wheeljack and then Perceptor too.  So one day we delivered an ite=
m to him and we got really curious about the work he was doing.  It just so=
 happened to be a similar project that Tucson was working on restoring but =
was missing some intel on it.  It was an old Cybertronian star chart and he=
 immediately identified the intel Perceptor had on it.  Perceptor was so ex=
cited when Tucson ran back to him with the artifact, and that's when our fr=
iendship came about.  And then Perceptor started teaching us a lot of inter=
esting facts and problem solving techniques.  One of them being how ta solv=
e a puzzle using a scientific process of elimination. "

Rattrap grins with=
 enthusiasm.

" I love that stuff!  Okay so let's see, Unicronian, strategi=
c, strong, dictator.  If not Unicron than someone who is kinda second in li=
ne.   Okay I know I paid attention in history class and, the only mug I kno=
w who fits all those categories is..."

Straight Shot gasps, and covers her=
 mouth.  The answer hitting her over the head quite hard.

" Oh scrap.  I s=
tudied history too, and I know who you might think it is. "

They both look=
 to Lord Elder and at the same time..

" MAGMATRON." 

Rattrap swallows har=
d.  

" Sir I really hope we're wrong about this.  Because if he came back,=
 we are so in deep slag.   But everything about the way things are going re=
ally points in that direction."

Straight Shot looks to the sky and then ba=
ck to Lord Elder. 

" Master Yokitron said that one day the ultimate challe=
nge would come, and we would be ready ta face it.  When the will and determ=
ination of friends and comrades joins forces against an impossible foe, thu=
nder would sound and lightning will be seen in the skies above.  And Magma =
will harden to the might of the rain that follows in thunder's wake.  Guys,=
 I think this is that time.  We are the storm and together we can do this .=
  Tucson is probably out there already, fighting the battle of his life in =
the name of freedom.  We can't let him do it alone."

Perpetually on the mo=
ve and constantly busy. 

On Sep 29, 2011, at 12:31 PM, Super Cyclonus <sup=
ercyclonus@...> wrote:

> > <OLD>
> >
> > Straight Shot looks to Talo=
n with a quick shake of her head. Yet she
> > appears in deep concentration=
 as if coming upon an important piece of a
> > puzzle.
> >
> > " Nope, noth=
ing yet Talon but, there are a few aspects that kind of help ta
> > narrow =
things down a little bit. First, from what we have all sensed, the
> > ener=
gy IFF readings appear ta be Unicronian in nature. So whoever it is,
> > de=
finitely must be a MINION of considerable power and they must be some sort
=
> > of authority figure. Like a military general who is a major tactician. =
And
> > that means they must be strong as well as smart. I wonder if we wou=
ld come
> > up with something by using those keywords ta do a digital intel=
 search and
> > see what that comes up with.."
> >
> > Rattrap nods.
> >
> =
> " It's worth a try. But Legacy is the only bot with that kinda access ta
=
> > that intel. But I bet he'd help ya do a search if the three of us asked=
.
> > It can't hurt ta know who and what we're up against."
> 
> <NEW>
> 
>=
 As SANTON rushed up onto the shuttle, follwed quickly enough by
> WINGCALI=
BER the others stayed on the pad in case they could be of
> other service.
=
> 
> TORCA looked at STRAIGHT SHOT, "You could be right." He said as he
> s=
tepped foward into the conversation, his Fuzors stepping up as well.
> They=
 were ready for action, well all except for SILVERBOLT who was
> still reco=
vering in the medbay.
> 
> "I have read the reports." NOCTORRO said. "I bel=
ieve Legacy will be
> here shortly as well. I am sure LEO PRIME will have a=
 few last minute
> orders for him as he get's this mission underway."
> 
> =
LORD ELDER entered as well. "Leo Prime is in conversation with Hydras,
> tr=
ying to close the deal that Tuscon opened. If he can do that, we
> might ge=
t some extra help."
> 
> He looked over at STRAIGHT SHOT, "So you think the=
se new enemies are
> working with the Unicronians?" He nodded as if giving =
the matter some
> serious thought. "Perhaps." He looked at the others. "Noc=
torro is
> right Legacy will be here to answer as many questions as he can
=
> answer. He is the closest thing we have to a science expert. I wish we
> =
had Perceptor here." He paused and added, "I mean the old Perceptor."
> 
> =
(TAG)
> 
> Preston
>

ee of us asked.<br>

t."<br>

<NEW><br>
<br>
As SANTON rushed up onto the shuttle, fol=
lwed quickly enough by<br>
WINGCALIBER the others stayed on the pad in case=
 they could be of<br>
other service.<br>
<br>
TORCA looked at STRAIGHT SHOT=
, "You could be right." He said as he<br>
stepped foward into the conversat=
ion, his Fuzors stepping up as well.<br>
They were ready for action, well a=
ll except for SILVERBOLT who was<br>
still recovering in the medbay.<br>
<b=
r>
"I have read the reports." NOCTORRO said. "I believe Legacy will be<br>
=
here shortly as well. I am sure LEO PRIME will have a few last minute<br>
o=
rders for him as he get's this mission underway."<br>

LORD ELDER enter=
ed as well. "Leo Prime is in conversation with Hydras,<br>
trying to close =
the deal that Tuscon opened. If he can do that, we<br>
might get some extra=

He looked over at STRAIGHT SHOT, "So you think these new e=
nemies are<br>
working with the Unicronians?" He nodded as if giving the ma=
tter some<br>
serious thought. "Perhaps." He looked at the others. "Noctorr=
o is<br>
right Legacy will be here to answer as many questions as he can<br=
>
answer. He is the closest thing we have to a science expert. I wish we<br=
>
had Perceptor here." He paused and added, "I mean the old Perceptor."<br>=
